title: Starting Point
text: The starting point of the base graph of $$x^2$$ has a vertex of $$(0,0)$$.

title: Transformations
text: To find the transformations involved with the graph, compare the new vertex with the vertex of $$x^2$$.

title: Left Transformation
text: For shifting the function left, add the shift to the $$x$$ inside of the parentheses with the square exponent.

title: Down Transformation
text: To shift the function down, add or subtract by the number of units shifted based on positive or negative shift outside of the exponent term.

title: General Form
text: What is the vertex form of the $$x^2$$ function shifted $$2$$ to the left and $$3$$ units down? Use a as the placeholder for the unknown stretch factor.

title: Stretch Factor
text: To solve for the stretch factor, input the coordinates of any point of the graph into the general form and solve for the value of a.
